summary: This document appears to be a J.P. Morgan entity account application form for an entity associated with Jeffrey Epstein. It contains entity information, ownership details, and authorized persons for account access, including Epstein and his associate Darren Indyke. The document is marked as confidential and part of the JPMorgan Chase production in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as an owner with 100% ownership interest in the entity applying for the J.P. Morgan account. His personal details, including date of birth and social security number, are referenced on the form.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Listed as an authorized person for information access regarding the account, with permission to receive account information and records.

connections.description: Darren Indyke is authorized to access account information for the J.P. Morgan entity account owned by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations.address: Little St. James Island, US Virgin Islands
locations.context: Listed as the address for the entity applying for the J.P. Morgan account, which is associated with Jeffrey Epstein's properties.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the 100% owner of an entity applying for a J.P. Morgan account, with the entity's address at Little St. James Island in the US Virgin Islands.
Darren Indyke is authorized to access account information and records for this Epstein-associated entity account.
The document is marked 'Confidential Treatment Requested' and is part of the JPMorgan Chase document production (JPM-SDNY-00001937) related to the Epstein case.
The application includes financial information requirements such as net worth, revenue, and assets, indicating the establishment of a financial account for Epstein's operations.
